title: What if Nether Grasp's suppression had a bit more "to do" for Malzahar to use it?
body:
> _**R: Nether Grasp**_
> 
> NEW Passive: While Nether Grasp is off cooldown, enemies damaged by Malzahar's other abilities gain a stack of Prophecy, up to a maximum of 5 stacks.
> 
> Active: Suppression duration changed from 2.5 seconds to 1.25 seconds + 0.25 seconds per stack of Prophecy on the target.

Reducing the up-front power of Nether Grasp in a way that interacts nicely with the many instances of repeated ability damage Malzahar has. Numbers may vary.

I don't know if he'd need any other changes with this, this was all I thought of.

replies.body:
Wow that's so stupid

You're officialy eligible to be hired by Riot

Or Riot can just remove his passive and admit their entire rework was retarded but we're not going to do that at all and just pretend it's not the problem

whatever, meddler the janna player

or..... it could be a skill shot, and keep its damage, cooldown, and duration.

But oh no. Last time i brought up that making it a skillshot would make it more fair to play against i got downvoted to oblivion and people stated that doing it would "gut" malzahar.

To be fair, some of the other targeted suppressions (Urgot, Warwick) were modified and turned into skillshots: Urgot has the chains and Warwick has the jump. Skarner's is point blank, but I'm not sure if they'll change it when it's Skarner's turn to be updated, and Tahm has to attack someone three times to eat them.
However, the problem is that Malzahar was designed to build damage, not build durability and set up fights or picks like Skarner or Tahm or Warwick, and even Urgot to a lesser degree.

They could probably make it like a ground sweep kind of skillshot where you pause for a split second, do some sound effect or whatever, and then the laser would scour the area in a line up to a certain range and "lock on" to the first champion it hits and then do the suppression tether for a couple seconds.

If you added something like this, it would actually have to make Malzahar's ult a LONGER duration as a pay off for his skill and properly using his kit, not shorten it. Making his ult more interactive might be a good change for him, but perhaps it should be more like Kayn's ult; that he has to mark them at all in order to use it rather than stacking, so he cant just flash cheese the ult anymore and force him to land his skill shots.
adding hoops to jump through doesnt make a character more fun or interesting, it just makes them a hassle to play.
